intro: Wahlenbergia capensis var. leiocalycina, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, tubular leaves and has a compact, spreading growth habit. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive flowers and hardy nature.
